Title:
Macrolepiota subcitrophylla, a new specied from southwest
China with yellowish lamellae
Keywords:
Agaricales, Agaricaceae, lepiotaceous fungi, taxonomy, new
taxon
Abstract:
Macrolepiota subcitrophylla sp. nov. is described from
Yunan and Hunan Province, southwestern China. Morphologically, it is
characterized by yellowish lamellae, relatively small, ovoid to
subamygdaliform-ellipsoid, dextrinoid spores with distinct germ pores,
narrowly clavate, clavate to subfusiform cheilocystidia, and a pileus
covering made up of a trichoderm of subcylindrical hyphae. Sequences
from the internal transcribed spacer region show that M. subcitrophylla
is distinct from all other tested Macrolepiota species, and suggests it
is the sister taxon to Macrolepiota clelandii, a species originally
described from Australia.
